texture.name: Information Texture
texture.longDescription: This dimension explores how you prefer information to be structured and presented. Some people need information that feels smooth and connected, while others prefer it rough and grippable. Some like it flexible and shifting, while others want to actively mold and shape it.

smooth_flowing.name: Smooth & Flowing
smooth_flowing.description: You prefer seamless, connected information that flows logically from one concept to the next, like a clear stream of ideas.
characteristics: Benefits from continuous, uninterrupted information flow
learningStrategies: Follow guided learning paths with clear progression
Create concept maps that show logical connections
Prefer courses with smooth, narrative structure
challenges: Can be overwhelmed by too many disconnected details

rough_grippable.name: Rough & Grippable
rough_grippable.description: You need concrete, tangible concepts with clear boundaries and specific details that you can mentally grasp and hold onto.
characteristics: Prefers concrete facts and specific details
Benefits from structured, discrete learning units
learningStrategies: Break information into specific, manageable chunks
Focus on practical examples and case studies
Create lists and bullet points for key concepts
challenges: Difficulty with ambiguous or fluid ideas
Can be overwhelmed by too much theoretical content

sand_shifting.name: Sand & Shifting
sand_shifting.description: You appreciate flexible, adaptable information that can be viewed from multiple perspectives and adjusted based on context.
learningStrategies: Adapt study methods based on context
Use flexible scheduling and varied approaches
challenges: Can be overwhelmed by too much structure

clay_moldable.name: Clay & Moldable
clay_moldable.description: You want to actively shape and transform ideas through hands-on manipulation, experimentation, and creative interaction.
characteristics: Prefers to modify and customize information
learningStrategies: Use mind mapping and concept manipulation
Build models and prototypes of concepts
challenges: Can be frustrated by limited interaction options

temperature.name: Learning Temperature
temperature.longDescription: This dimension reveals your emotional and cognitive temperature preferences. Some people learn best in cool, analytical environments, while others need warm, narrative contexts. Some thrive on hot, urgent energy, while others prefer alternating temperatures.

cool_logical.name: Cool & Logical
cool_logical.description: You thrive in objective, analytical environments with systematic reasoning and data-driven approaches.
learningStrategies: Focus on data and evidence-based content
challenges: May struggle with highly emotional content
Difficulty with subjective or personal materials
Can be overwhelmed by too much narrative context

warm_narrative.name: Warm & Narrative
warm_narrative.description: You learn best through stories, emotional connections, and personally meaningful contexts that create human connection.
learningStrategies: Focus on human elements and relationships
challenges: May struggle with purely analytical content
Can be overwhelmed by too much data without context

hot_urgent.name: Hot & Urgent
hot_urgent.description: You're motivated by intensity, immediacy, and high-stakes applications with clear deadlines and competitive elements.
learningStrategies: Set tight deadlines and challenging goals
challenges: Can be overwhelmed by low-pressure environments

alternating_temp.name: Alternating Temperature
alternating_temp.description: You benefit from variety in emotional intensity and pacing, switching between different approaches based on context and needs.
learningStrategies: Mix intensive and relaxed study periods
Switch between analytical and narrative modes
challenges: Can be overwhelmed by monotonous approaches

ecosystem.name: Concept Ecosystem
ecosystem.longDescription: This dimension explores how you mentally organize and relate concepts. Some people see ideas growing organically like a garden, others prefer systematic structures like a city, hierarchical layers like a forest, or deep connections like an ocean.

garden_organic.name: Garden & Organic
garden_organic.description: You see natural, evolving connections between ideas that grow organically and develop unexpected relationships.
learningStrategies: Allow for natural discovery and exploration
challenges: Can be overwhelmed by too much structure

city_systems.name: City & Systems
city_systems.description: You prefer organized, systematic relationships with clear functions, defined roles, and structured interactions.
challenges: Can be overwhelmed by too much organic growth

forest_hierarchical.name: Forest & Hierarchical
forest_hierarchical.description: You think in structured levels and hierarchies, building from foundational ground level to complex canopy concepts.
challenges: Can be overwhelmed by flat information structures

ocean_depth.name: Ocean & Depth
ocean_depth.description: You explore deep, far-reaching connections that span vast conceptual distances, like underwater currents connecting distant shores.
challenges: Can be overwhelmed by superficial approaches

temporal.name: Learning Rhythms
temporal.longDescription: This dimension reveals your preferred pacing and timing patterns. Some people work best with steady, tidal rhythms, others prefer seasonal cycles of deep work, lightning-burst intensity, or heartbeat-like maintenance patterns.

tidal_steady.name: Tidal & Steady
tidal_steady.description: You work best with consistent, regular patterns and predictable learning rhythms, like steady ocean tides.
challenges: Can be overwhelmed by unpredictable timing

seasonal_deep.name: Seasonal & Deep
seasonal_deep.description: You prefer cycles of extensive preparation followed by periods of intensive learning and growth, like natural seasons.
challenges: Can be overwhelmed by non-cyclical approaches

lightning_burst.name: Lightning & Burst
lightning_burst.description: You learn through sudden insights and intense focus sessions, capitalizing on moments of high energy and breakthrough understanding.
learningStrategies: Be ready to act on sudden insights
challenges: Can be overwhelmed by forced regular schedules

heartbeat_maintenance.name: Heartbeat & Maintenance
heartbeat_maintenance.description: You maintain steady progress with periodic acceleration, balancing regular maintenance with strategic intensification.
learningStrategies: Balance regular maintenance with periodic intensity
Maintain steady progress with strategic acceleration
challenges: May struggle with purely steady or purely intense approaches
Can be overwhelmed by non-pulsed patterns

spatial.name: Mental Construction
spatial.longDescription: This dimension explores how you mentally build and organize new knowledge. Some people build systematically from foundations up, others start with big pictures and work down, use modular approaches, or allow organic flow.

foundation_up.name: Foundation Up
foundation_up.description: You build knowledge systematically from basic principles to complex applications, ensuring solid foundations before advancing.
challenges: Can be overwhelmed by complex overviews

big_picture_down.name: Big Picture Down
big_picture_down.description: You start with comprehensive overviews and progressively fill in specific details, beginning with the whole before the parts.
learningStrategies: Fill in details within big-picture context
challenges: Can be overwhelmed by fragmented starts

modular.name: Modular
modular.description: You learn in independent pieces that can be flexibly combined and connected later, building understanding through component assembly.
challenges: Can be overwhelmed by forced connections

flowing.name: Flowing
flowing.description: You allow understanding to develop organically following natural curiosity and interest, letting knowledge emerge naturally.
challenges: Can be overwhelmed by external organization
